SourceProxy.label: Gradient
SourceProxy.name: Gradient

Documentation.long_help: This filter computes gradient vectors for an image/volume.

SourceProxy.Documentation: The Gradient filter computes the gradient vector at each point in an image or volume. This filter uses central differences to compute the gradients. The Gradient filter operates on uniform rectilinear (image) data and produces image data output.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the input to the Gradient filter.

StringVectorProperty.name: SelectInputScalars
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property lists the name of the array from which to compute the gradient.

IntVectorProperty.name: Dimensionality
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property indicates whether to compute the gradient in two dimensions or in three. If the gradient is being computed in two dimensions, the X and Y dimensions are used.

SourceProxy.label: Gradient Magnitude
SourceProxy.name: GradientMagnitude

Documentation.long_help: Compute the magnitude of the gradient vectors for an image/volume.

SourceProxy.Documentation: The Gradient Magnitude filter computes the magnitude of the gradient vector at each point in an image or volume. This filter operates on uniform rectilinear (image) data and produces image data output.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the input to the Gradient Magnitude filter.

IntVectorProperty.name: Dimensionality
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property indicates whether to compute the gradient magnitude in two or three dimensions. If computing the gradient magnitude in 2D, the gradients in X and Y are used for computing the gradient magnitude.

SourceProxy.name: Median

Documentation.long_help: Compute the median scalar values in a specified neighborhood for image/volume datasets.
Documentation.short_help: Compute median values in a given neighborhood.

SourceProxy.Documentation: The Median filter operates on uniform rectilinear (image or volume) data and produces uniform rectilinear output. It replaces the scalar value at each pixel / voxel with the median scalar value in the specified surrounding neighborhood. Since the median operation removes outliers, this filter is useful for removing high-intensity, low-probability noise (shot noise).

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the input to the Median filter.

StringVectorProperty.name: SelectInputScalars
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The value of this property lists the name of the scalar array to use in computing the median.

IntVectorProperty.name: KernelSize
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: The value of this property specifies the number of pixels/voxels in each dimension to use in computing the median to assign to each pixel/voxel. If the kernel size in a particular dimension is 1, then the median will not be computed in that direction.
